author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Manipal Hospitals here has achieved the distinction of the first hospital in the western districts of Salem, Erode, Namakkal, Dharmapuri, and Krishnagiri to have performed the first cadaver liver transplant.

The recipient of the first liver transplant was Vishnu Namboodiri (62), a former bank manager from Kochi.

The successful transplant was performed by a six-member doctor team led by A. Olithselvan, consultant hepatologist and chairman, division of liver transplantation, Manipal Hospitals.

Dr. Olithselvan and V. Jayaraman, Salem unit head, told reporters here that Mr. Namboodiri was diagnosed for cirrhosis of the liver some six months back.

He was a long term diabetic patient and had developed a condition called Non-Alcoholic Fatty liver Disease.

His only option for survival was to transplant his damaged liver with a new one.

When A 59-year-old man was declared brain dead at a private hospital in Coimbatore, his family members came forward to donate his organs.

The liver was allotted to Mr. Vishnu who was brought to Manipal Hospital, Salem.

The liver was retrieved from the donor by a team headed by Magnus Mansard, liver transplant surgeon, Manipal Hospital, Salem.

The organ was transported from Coimbatore to Salem through a specially created “green corridor” with the help of police protection.

Mr. Namboodiri was able to walk now, said Dr. Olithselvan.

Doctors said that it was for the first time the hospital was performing the surgery
title: Cadaver liver transplant at Manipal Hospital, a success
